alert.note: Alert for Baca (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 4:43PM MDT until July 30 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Baca County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 645 PM MDT. * At 443 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over open country south of Stonington. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stonington and open country south of Stonington. This includes the following streams and drainages... North Fork Cimarron River, Sand Arroyo Creek and Dry Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
